intro: Payena dasyphylla var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved payena, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glabrous, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
